Description: Sherd of small Linear Style Corinthian pottery kotyle (kotyliskos) consisting of rim and body with handle root; interior: glazed black; exterior: frieze of short vertical strokes in handle area between black bands; below two rows of staggered dots between two wide bands in added red; below, two narrow black bands above row of debased tongues at base of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 98, no. A141, pl. LXIX)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.317) (phase 3)
